forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 54, with temperatures rising to around 57 overnight. South southwest wind 9 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
A soft veil of clouds hangs over Downtown San Francisco this morning, cloaking the city in a gentle cap of gray. The tail end of yesterday's light rain lingers in the air, hinting at the moistness that will soon give way to a steady fall as the afternoon approaches. With a slight chance of lingering drizzle early on and a promise of heavier rain tonight, it seems the brisk south winds wrap the streets in a brisk chill, compelling one to don a warm jacket. While the high may hover around 59, the cool embrace of the atmosphere feels almost a touch colder; appropriate layers are wise for those venturing out.

As the day ebbs into evening, it will grace us with deeper clouds, foretelling the deluge promised by the 100% chance of rain. Steady precipitation will creep in, encouraging a retreat indoors. Take this opportunity to sidestep the usual tourist attractions and explore the more intimate corners of the city: perhaps a cozy café nestled in the Mission or a quaint bookstore in North Beach. Enjoy the ambiance of this atmospheric day, where the charm of San Francisco dances in rhythm with the rain’s melody, as the city dons a tranquil cloak, inviting moments of splendid solitude or shared laughter over a warm drink.
